meanings.definition: To make (something) appealing to the general public.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was popularizing the new learning method to help all students understand better.
meanings.sent2: The company was popularizing their new product through social media advertisements.
meanings.sent3: The magician was popularizing his disappearing act to entertain the audience.
meanings.sent4: The artist was popularizing her unique style, making waves in the art world.
meanings.sent5: The chef was popularizing his signature dish, attracting food enthusiasts from all over.

meanings.definition: To bring (something) to the attention of a wider audience.
meanings.sent1: The singer was popularizing her new song by performing it on various talk shows.
meanings.sent2: The author was popularizing his latest book by organizing book signings in different cities.
meanings.sent3: The comedian was popularizing his jokes by sharing them on social media.
meanings.sent4: The activist was popularizing her cause, rallying support from people worldwide.
meanings.sent5: The scientist was popularizing her research findings, presenting them at international conferences.
